chapter_title: Piston Engines - Performance and Power Augmentation

questions.question: The Manifold Pressure Gauge fitted to a supercharged engine measures:
options: a. the absolute pressure in the induction manifold
b. the differential pressure across the supercharger compressor
c. the ratio between the atmospheric pressure and the cam rise at the supercharger inlet
d. the pressure upstream of the throttle valve

questions.question: An Automatic Boost Control Unit:
options: a. prevents detonation and dissociation in the cylinder
b. maintains an automatic preset boost pressure
c. maintains the correct mixture strength for the boost pressure set
d. sets the position of the wastegate to ensure the preset boost is maintained

questions.question: The use of a turbocharger on an engine will:
options: a. improve the exhaust scavenging efficiency
b. raise the volumetric efficiency of the engine
c. cause an automatic rise in the engine rpm as altitude is gained
d. cause an automatic rise in engine power as altitude is gained

questions.question: The motive force used to drive the turbocharger is:
options: a. torque from the crankshaft via a spring drive unit
b. torque from the accessory gearbox
c. energy from the exhaust that would otherwise have been wasted
d. energy from the reduction gearbox

questions.question: The power increase that occurs with initial increase in altitude when an engine has an internal supercharger fitted, is due to:
options: a. the reduced weight of mixture being passed to the engine
b. the decreasing density of the atmosphere
c. the reducing exhausts back pressure
d. the increasing charge temperature

questions.question: Rated Altitude is:
options: a. the height at which the boost pressure ceases to be effective with a specific rpm set
b. a comparison between the boost pressure at sea level and that at a given altitude
c. the maximum altitude at which Rated Boost can be maintained with Rated rpm set
d. the altitude at which the wastegate becomes fully shut

questions.question: The speed of the turbine of a turbocharger is controlled by:
options: a. the diversion of exhaust gases
b. controlling the exit of the exhaust gas passing out of the eye of the impeller
c. the use of a variable controller
d. an automatic gearbox positioned between the turbine and the impeller

questions.question: The turbocharger wastegate is spring loaded towards:
options: a. the open position
b. the closed position
c. a neutrally balanced partly open position
d. the maximum boost position

questions.question: The turbocharger bearing is lubricated and cooled by:
options: a. its own internal self-contained oil system
b. a total loss system
c. the engine oil
d. a tapping in the scavenge oil system

questions.question: Static Boost is:
options: a. always the ISA atmospheric pressure for the airfield altitude
b. obtained by opening the throttle to give a boost gauge reading of 30 in Hg or 0 psi.
c. the boost pressure gauge reading when the engine is not running. Selecting a suitable throttle position will give the same boost gauge reading when the engine is running
d. the difference between the induction manifold pressure and the exhaust manifold pressure

questions.question: The automatic boost pressure control capsules are made sensitive to:
options: a. atmospheric pressure
b. carburettor inlet pressure
c. boost pressure
d. cabin pressure differential

questions.question: In order to maintain a constant boost pressure with increasing altitude, the ABC:
options: a. holds the throttle valve at a constant position
b. progressively opens the throttle valve
c. progressively closes the wastegate
d. progressively closes the throttle valve

questions.question: "Boost pressure" is the:
options: a. inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below standard mean sea level pressure
b. absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in inches of mercury
c. absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in millibars
d. inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below atmospheric pressure

questions.question: "Full Throttle Height" is:
options: a. the height at which the engine is at Rated Boost
b. the maximum height at which a specified boost can be maintained at a specified rpm
c. the height at which the wastegate is fully closed
d. the cruising height for any specific boost

questions.question: The purpose of an intercooler is:
options: a. to minimize the risk of detonation
b. to increase the volume of the charge
c. to decrease the density of the charge
d. to prevent overheating of the exhaust manifold

questions.question: The function of a diffuser in a supercharger is:
options: a. to decrease the temperature and increase the velocity of the charge
b. to increase the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge
c. to decrease the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge
d. to decrease the velocity and increase the pressure of the charge

questions.question: Air enters the compressor of a turbosupercharger:
options: a. at the tip and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the eye
b. at the diffuser and exits at the impeller
c. at the eye and passes across the diffuser blades before exiting at the impeller tip
d. at the eye and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the tip

questions.question: The wastegate of a turbosupercharger is fitted:
options: a. in the turbine bypass
b. in the inlet manifold
c. to maximize exhaust back pressure
d. in series with the turbine

questions.question: The wastegate is operated by:
options: a. the automatic boost control unit
b. the wastegate actuator
c. inlet manifold pressure
d. exhaust gas temperature

questions.question: With a turbocharger installed on the engine, its exhaust back pressure:
options: a. remains the same
b. is decreased
c. is increased
d. decreases in the climb

questions.question: A high performance supercharger may require an intercooler to be placed:
options: a. between the supercharger and the inlet valve
b. at the carburettor intake
c. between each cylinder
d. between the engine block and the exhaust manifold

questions.question: With an increase of compressor discharge pressure the fuel flow will:
options: a. increase
b. remain constant
c. decrease
d. increase, but only in proportion to altitude increase

questions.question: A turbocharger's rotational speed is determined by:
options: a. the diversion of exhaust gas
b. the position of the throttle valve
c. the density of the air at the compressor intake
d. bleeding off excess exhaust pressure

questions.question: During take-off from a sea level airfield with ISA conditions, the position of the wastegate of a turbocharged engine is:
options: a. fully open
b. almost fully open
c. controlled by the throttle position
d. fully closed

questions.question: Maximum Continuous Power (MCP) is:
options: a. unrestricted, but only if economical cruising power is set
b. the maximum power the engine will give at any time
c. given a 5 minute limitation
d. unrestricted

questions.question: The primary purpose of a supercharger is to:
options: a. raise the temperature of the charge entering the cylinder
b. increase the mass of the charge entering the cylinder
c. improve the engine's exhaust scavenging capability, and hence increase its power output
d. allow the use of high octane fuel

questions.question: The type of fuel used in a turbocharged engine would be:
options: a. AVTUR
b. AVGAS
c. AVTAG
d. AVPIN

questions.question: At an idle or low power condition, the turbocharger wastegate is normally:
options: a. partially open
b. fully open
c. closed
d. half open

questions.question: When the air or the mixture passes through the diffuser shroud, the energy conversion is from:
options: a. kinetic to pressure
b. heat to potential
c. mechanical to heat
d. potential to kinetic

questions.question: The construction of a turbocharger ensures that the turbine and the compressor:
options: a. are on the same shaft
b. are on different shafts
c. are connected by mechanical gearing
d. are controlled by the ABC

questions.question: The wastegate fitted to a turbocharger regulates the quantity of:
options: a. the mixture that enters the induction manifold
b. the atmosphere that can enter the compressor
c. the exhaust gas that will bypass the turbine
d. the exhaust gas that leaves the compressor

questions.question: The main function of a supercharger is to:
options: a. increase the thermal efficiency of the engine
b. increase the compression ratio of the engine
c. maintain sea level pressure in the engine to above rated altitude
d. increase the volumetric efficiency of the engine

questions.question: The response of a turbocharged engine to rapid throttle opening, when compared to a normally aspirated engine:
options: a. is initially better, but exhaust back pressure will cause a flat spot
b. is always better
c. is worse
d. is identical

questions.question: With a constant manifold pressure set during the climb, the power output from an internally supercharged engine:
options: a. decreases
b. increases
c. remains constant
d. is unaffected by altitude change

questions.question: An internal supercharger is one which:
options: a. is driven by exhaust gases
b. compresses the air
c. compresses the exhaust gases
d. compresses the mixture

questions.question: If the wastegate of a turbocharged engine seizes in the climb before critical altitude has been reached:
options: a. engine power will be automatically adjusted by the ABC
b. engine power will rise by approximately 10%
c. reducing back pressure will compensate for any loss in power
d. engine power will fall as the climb continues

questions.question: To prevent large acceleration loads on the compressor and the drive shaft of an internal supercharger, it is usual to:
options: a. prohibit "slam" acceleration
b. incorporate a spring drive mechanism in the driving gears
c. rely on the inertia absorbing qualities of the exhaust gases
d. use a Vernier drive coupling

questions.question: The rotational speed of the turbocharger of an engine which is at full throttle at low altitude is:
options: a. between minimum and maximum
b. maximum
c. controlled by the ABC
d. minimum

questions.question: Maintaining a constant manifold pressure in a turbocharged engine during the climb will cause:
options: a. the exhaust gas temperature to decrease due to a decrease in exhaust back pressure
b. the wastegate to open
c. the wastegate to progressively close
d. the diffuser rotational speed to increase

questions.question: Overboosting an engine fitted with a turbocharger is prevented by the installation of:
options: a. an automatic boost control unit
b. a manifold pressure gauge
c. a wastegate pressure controller
d. a suck in flap

questions.question: A turbocharger which is designed to maintain sea level pressure at altitude is termed:
options: a. an altitude-boosted turbocharger
b. a turbosupercharger
c. an internal supercharger
d. a ground boosted turbocharger

questions.question: With the power lever opened for take-off power at sea level, the throttle butterfly of an engine fitted with an internal supercharger would be:
options: a. fully open
b. in a choked position
c. partially open
d. fully closed

questions.question: "Static Boost" is the manifold pressure indicated on the boost pressure gauge when:
options: a. the engine is stopped
b. the engine is running at the manufacturer's recommended idle speed
c. the engine is running at its rated power
d. the manifold gauge needle is opposite the lubber line

questions.question: The limit of the amount of supercharging that an engine can tolerate is reached when:
options: a. maximum rpm is reached
b. the engine is at its rated altitude
c. maximum boost pressure is obtained
d. the engine starts to suffer from detonation

questions.question: The rotational speed of a turbocharger is dependent upon:
options: a. engine rpm and wastegate position
b. engine rpm only
c. throttle position only
d. propeller pitch and altitude

questions.question: The inlet manifold pressure of a turbocharged engine in an aircraft which is climbing will:
options: a. increase to full throttle height and then fall
b. increase to critical height and then remain constant
c. remain constant to critical altitude and then fall
d. decrease to critical altitude and then remain constant

questions.question: The type of compressor normally used in a supercharger is:
options: a. an axial compressor
b. a Rootes compressor
c. a centrifugal compressor
d. a reciprocating thrunge compressor

questions.question: The compressor output pressure of an internal supercharger is:
options: a. the same as manifold pressure
b. greater than the manifold pressure
c. sometimes greater, sometimes less than the manifold pressure
d. less than the manifold pressure

questions.question: The position of the wastegate in a turbocharged engine is:
options: a. in the inlet manifold
b. downstream of the turbine
c. in parallel with the turbine
d. in parallel with the compressor

questions.question: The maximum engine brake horsepower with a specified rpm and manifold pressure set which permits continuous safe operation is termed:
options: a. maximum power
b. take-off power
c. critical power
d. rated power

questions.question: The compressor output of a turbocharger unit is:
options: a. the same as the manifold pressure
b. greater than the manifold pressure
c. sometimes greater, sometimes less than the manifold pressure
d. less than manifold pressure

questions.question: Within the compressor of a turbocharger:
options: a. the pressure increases and the temperature decreases
b. both the pressure and the temperature increase
c. both the pressure and the temperature decrease
d. the pressure increases and the temperature remains constant

questions.question: The type of compressor normally fitted to turbochargers and superchargers would compress the air:
options: a. axially
b. co-axially
c. in the diffuser only
d. centrifugally

questions.question: If the wastegate of a turbocharged engine seizes during the climb, the manifold pressure will:
options: a. remain constant
b. decrease
c. increase
d. initially increase and then decrease

questions.question: To maintain the Rated Boost of a supercharged engine while reducing the rpm:
options: a. the throttle valve must be opened
b. the wastegate must be closed
c. the wastegate must be opened
d. the throttle valve must be closed

questions.question: The effect of selecting Rated Boost, but less than Rated rpm on the climb, would be that:
options: a. the Rated Altitude would be lower
b. the Full Throttle Height would be less
c. the Rated Altitude would be higher
d. the Full Throttle Height would be higher

questions.question: The Automatic Boost Control Unit operates:
options: a. the Boost Control Lever
b. the wastegate
c. the throttle butterfly
d. the rpm gauge and the manifold pressure gauge

questions.question: Boost pressure is indicated on:
options: a. the cylinder head temperature gauge
b. the manifold pressure gauge
c. the fuel pressure gauge
d. the rpm gauge and the manifold pressure gauge

questions.question: With an increase of compressor discharge pressure, the fuel flow will:
options: a. decrease
b. remain constant
c. initially increase, but subsequently decrease
d. increase

questions.question: Superchargers are used to overcome:
options: a. the decrease in density due to the increase in altitude
b. the increase in temperature due to the increase in altitude
c. the fuel density variation that occurs with an increase in altitude
d. the exhaust back pressure

questions.question: The boost pressure of a turbocharged engine is controlled by:
options: a. adjusting the throttle position
b. varying the speed of the turbocharger
c. the ABC
d. changing engine rpm.

questions.question: In a supercharger, the mixture:
options: a. enters through the eye of the impeller and leaves at the periphery
b. enters at the periphery and leaves through the eye
c. enters through the turbine and leaves through the compressor
d. enters through the compressor and leaves through the turbine
